intro: Centratherum australianum, commonly known as the Australian starburry, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has slender, upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Centratherum australianum is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
